article.headline: La Salle 68, Massachusetts 61
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Steven Smith scored 24 points and Jermaine Thomas added 19 as La Salle defeated Massachusetts 68-61, ending a five-game losing streak. Darnell Harris had 14 points for La Salle (11-7, 3-4 Atlantic 10), which had won its first seven games of the season. James Life had 14 points and Stephane Lasme had 13 points and 12 rebounds for the Minutemen (9-8, 4-3). The Explorers led 33-26 at the half and took their biggest lead, 50-37, on a layup by Tabby Cunningham with 15 minutes left in the game. UMass closed to within 59-56 on a jumper by Chris Lowe with 2:25 left in the game, but Thomas hit a 16-footer at the 1:50 mark, and then two free-throws with 27 seconds to go, to seal the win. Smith scored 13 points in the first half, while Massachusetts made only 10-of-29 shots and had seven turnovers in the first 20 minutes.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
